intro: Nauclea callophylla, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Nauclea callophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adaptable to various climatic conditions.
